skill.name: makepad-evolution
skill.description: Self-improving skill system for Makepad development. Features self-evolution (accumulate knowledge), self-correction (fix errors automatically), self-validation (verify accuracy), usage feedback (track pattern health), version adaptation (multi-branch support), and personalization (adapt to project style). Use to continuously improve makepad-skills during development.
skill.summary: Self-improving skill system for Makepad development. Features self-evolution (accumulate knowledge),...
skill.author: ZhangHanDong

security_audit.summary: All 170 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. SKILL.md is a pure documentation file containing markdown instructions with code examples. The static analyzer detected patterns in documentation (git commands in code blocks, file paths with dots, GitHub URLs) but these are not executable code. This is purely documentation content for a skill system. No network calls, no file operations, no command execution capabilities exist in this skill.

content.value_statement: Managing Makepad skill documentation manually is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill enables Claude to automatically improve, validate, and personalize skill content based on development experience.
actual_capabilities: Automatically detect Makepad version from Cargo.toml and adapt suggestions
Scan project code to personalize suggestions to match coding style
Self-correct skill content when suggested code causes compilation errors
Track pattern usage and success rates for health reporting
Document new patterns and solutions discovered during development
Validate all skill content against current Makepad API
limitations: Only works with Makepad projects, not other frameworks
Cannot modify code outside of skill documentation files
Self-evolution requires user confirmation before committing changes
Does not execute or test code, only documents patterns

use_cases.title: Build reusable pattern library
use_cases.description: Automatically capture and document widget patterns discovered during development for future reuse.

use_cases.title: Manage version differences
use_cases.description: Automatically detect which Makepad branch is in use and provide appropriate API guidance.

use_cases.title: Keep documentation accurate
use_cases.description: Automatically validate and correct skill content when outdated patterns cause errors.

prompt_templates.title: Start development session
prompt_templates.prompt: Start a Makepad development session with version detection and project style scanning enabled.

prompt_templates.title: Document a new pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: I discovered a useful pattern during development. Add it to makepad-patterns following the evolution process.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skills
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate makepad-skills against current Makepad version and report any outdated patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Review pattern health
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me pattern health report for makepad-skills and identify patterns that need review.

output_examples.input: Validate makepad-skills against current Makepad version
output: - Pattern 8: Timer setup uses outdated API (dev branch only)
- makepad-shaders: Missing shader example for current Makepad
Recommend: Run self-correction to fix these issues?

output_examples.input: Show me pattern health report for makepad-skills
output: - Pattern 5: Loading Button - 67% success rate (Needs Review)
Patterns with low success rates should be reviewed and corrected.

best_practices: Enable automatic version detection at session start for accurate API guidance
Use self-correction immediately when skill advice causes errors
Review pattern health reports regularly to identify broken patterns
Follow the evolution marker format when contributing new patterns
anti_patterns: Manually editing skill files without evolution markers
Ignoring pattern health warnings when success rates drop below 70%
Using outdated patterns without checking current Makepad version
Deleting patterns instead of marking them as deprecated with explanation

faq.question: How does self-correction work?
faq.answer: When code from a skill causes an error, Claude automatically identifies the issue, finds the correct approach, and updates the skill file.

faq.question: What version branches are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports main (stable), dev (latest features), and rik (legacy) branches with automatic version detection and API adaptation.

faq.question: Can I use this without Git?
faq.answer: Self-improvement features work locally, but evolution contributions require Git to track changes and create proper commit messages.

faq.question: How is personalization stored?
faq.answer: Detected project style preferences are stored in the project's .claude/settings.json file for future sessions.

faq.question: Does it run automatically?
faq.answer: Version detection, personalization, and self-correction run automatically. Self-evolution and validation require user prompts or confirmation.

faq.question: What patterns are tracked?
faq.answer: The skill tracks all pattern usage from makepad-patterns, makepad-shaders, and makepad-troubleshooting with success and failure counts.
